00072 #include "actorbase.h"
00073 
00074 ///////////////////////////////////
00075 // Actual code
00076 namespace phys
00077 {
00078     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00079     /// @class ActorSoft
00080     /// @headerfile actorbase.h
00081     /// @brief This is the actor class for Soft Objects.
00082     /// @details This class should be used to make any soft object that, like ActorRigid,
00083     /// can be moved or manipulated as a result of force.  Examples of soft objects are: Paper,
00084     /// Rope, and Cloth.  Semi Rigid bodies that are still somewhat deformable, like Jello,
00085     /// should be made as a soft object.
00086     /// @warning Currently this is not fully implemented and will likely cause errors if used.
00087     ///////////////////////////////////////
00088     class ActorSoft: public ActorBase {
00089         protected:
00090             ///@brief Used to simulate the functionality of a btSoftBody for use with the physics subsystem.
00091             btSoftBody* physsoftbody;
00092             /// @brief Creates a soft object for the actor.
00093             /// @details Creates a soft object to be placed in the physics world later. @n
00094             /// This is automaticly called by the Constructor and shouldn't be called manually.
00095             /// @param softworldinfo Currently Unused
00096             /// @param nodecount Currently Unused
00097             /// @param nodearray Currently Unused
00098             /// @param massarray Currently Unused
00099             void CreateSoftObject (btSoftBodyWorldInfo* softworldinfo, int nodecount, btVector3* nodearray, btScalar* massarray);
00100             /// @brief Adds the actor to the physics world.
00101             /// @details Adds the actor to the physics world. @n
00102             /// This is automaticly called by the PhysWorlds AddActor function and shouldn't be called manually.
00103             /// @param TargetWorld Pointer to the World class.
00104             /// @param btWorld Pointer to the physics world.
00105             void AddObjectToWorld (World *TargetWorld, btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld* btWorld);
00106 
00107         public:
00108             ActorSoft();
00109             /// @brief Destructor.
00110             /// @details The class destructor.
00111             virtual ~ActorSoft();
00112             /// @brief Creates a collision shape from mesh file.
00113             /// @details This function will read the location of every verticy in the mesh file and use that to
00114             /// construct a triangle mesh shape and attach it to this objects collision shape.
00115             void CreateShapeFromMesh();
00116     };
00117 }
00118 #endif
